Package soot.jimple.infoflow.android.axml

Class ApkHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.android.axml.ApkHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    public class ApkHandler
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Provides access to the files within an APK and can add and replace files.
    Author:
    Stefan Haas, Mario Schlipf

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected File apk
      The handled APK file.
      protected ZipFile zip
      Pointer to the ZipFile.

      Adds the files to the APK which is handled by this ApkHandler.
      void close()
      Closes this apk file

      Returns the absolute path of the APK which is held by the ApkHandler.

      Returns the filename of the APK which is held by the ApkHandler.

      Returns an InputStream for a file within the APK.

    • Field Detail

      • apk

        protected File apk
        The handled APK file.

      • zip

        protected ZipFile zip
        Pointer to the ZipFile. If an InputStream for a file within the ZipFile is returned by getInputStream(String) the ZipFile object has to remain available in order to read the InputStream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ApkHandler

        public ApkHandler​(String path)
           throws ZipException,
                  IOException
        Parameters:
        path - the APK's path
        Throws:
        ZipException - occurs if the APK is no a valid zip file.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        ApkHandler(File)

      • ApkHandler

        public ApkHandler​(File apk)
           throws ZipException,
                  IOException
        Creates a new ApkHandler which handles the given APK file.
        Parameters:
        apk - the APK's path
        Throws:
        ZipException - occurs if the APK is no a valid zip file.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • getAbsolutePath

        public String getAbsolutePath()
        Returns the absolute path of the APK which is held by the ApkHandler.
        See Also:
        File.getAbsolutePath()

      • getPath

        public String getPath()
        Returns the path of the APK which is held by the ApkHandler.
        See Also:
        File.getPath()

      • getFilename

        public String getFilename()
        Returns the filename of the APK which is held by the ApkHandler.
        See Also:
        File.getName()

      • getInputStream

        public InputStream getInputStream​(String filename)
                           throws IOException
        Returns an InputStream for a file within the APK.
        The given filename has to be the relative path within the APK, e.g. res/menu/main.xml
        Parameters:
        filename - the file's path
        Returns:
        InputStream for the searched file, if not found null
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • addFilesToApk

        public void addFilesToApk​(List<File> files)
                   throws IOException
        Parameters:
        files - array with File objects to be added to the APK.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • addFilesToApk

        public void addFilesToApk​(List<File> files,
                          Map<String,​String> paths)
                   throws IOException
        Adds the files to the APK which is handled by this ApkHandler.
        Parameters:
        files - Array with File objects to be added to the APK.
        paths - Map containing paths where to put the files. The Map's keys are the file's paths: paths.get(file.getPath())
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this apk file
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
